reviews.sentence: OUTSTANDING hotel and service. I stayed at the Best Western Tuscan in San Francisco from 1415 1915 and absolutely loved it. Whenever I return to San Francisco this will be the only hotel I stay at. The hotel offers a lot of freebies including am town car limo service to the downtown financial district evening wine tasting refrigerator and wifi. It is also within easy walking distance to just about every major tourist attraction you can think of including pier 33 pier 39 pier 45 the street car stops and the cable car stops. They also have a restaurant on site that offers room service. My experience with this hotel was exceptionally wonderful and I HIGHLY recommend any visitor to the city to book with them without hesitation.

Good experience would recommend. The Tuscan offers excellent value in a rather expensive city. Rooms are comfortable staff is very good and the location is excellent for vacation travellers. This is one of the better Best Western hotels and a good choice.

Terrific Location. We enjoyed every aspect of our stay at this hotel. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Very friendly and helpful staff. The location was great as we could walk to almost every place we wanted to go. Easy access to Cable Cars and buses as well.

Perfect location. We stayed here for 4 nights during our family trip to SF. This was our first stay at a Best Western and it was a great experience. The location could not be beat. We were in close distance to several great highly rated breakfast spots as well as tour bus stops the cable cars fishermans wharf and Little Italy. We could even walk to China Town and Lombard street from the hotel. I could not imagine a better location. This was one of the only hotels I found with queen size beds. The rooms were nice and clean.

Nice hotel with a couple issues. Our experience at the Tuscan Inn was a good one nice surprise for a Best Western except for 2 important things. Although the room was updated and well appointed it was extremely small. The bathroom sink mirror was IN the bedroom no door and to use the light in the commode shower you also had turn on the light to the sink which illuminated the bedroom. Not nice in the middle of the night. The sink area and the actual toilet were dollhouse sized not possible to share the space. The air conditioner would shift into a very loud overdrive mode every 5 minutes or so again not nice while trying to sleep. The bed was super comfortable though.

Great location on Fishermans Wharf. We stayed there for 3 nights and throughly enjoyed the experience. The hotel is close to Fishermans Wharf only two streets back on the corner of Mason and North Point and access to great food and the hop on hop off buses as well as Pier 33 where the Alcatraz Tour departs. While the room was relatively small it was clean and offered free wi fi. A bonus was that they also had a free wine Happy Hour the nights were there between 5 6pm. where we met other travellers and discussed shared our adventures and often carried onto having dinner with them. Great atmosphere and recommended to others.
The good experience staff very friendly and confortable hotel. Near by the most atractions restaurants cafe and etc.
perfect. good experience and nice.

Nice time in San Fran. Well located for Fishermans Wharf experience. Rooms are small but adequate. Place is clean staff is friendly helpful. You get free coffee tea in the morning which is nice. Location Free coffee. All the Fishermans Wharf stuff Boudins Pier 39 Boat Tours of Bay Ripleys within easy walking distance of Lombard St. It could use a renovation which they told us will begin in Jan 2017.

Location is outstanding. From the valet to guest check in it was a great experience. The hotel is located a block off Fishermans Wharf with easy walking access to everything. Cable cars and trolley are nearby making it fun to go touring. The restaurant serves a good breakfast the rooms are clean with lovely linens. It was a great hotel to spend the last day of our California get away.
Great location and decent size room. Even though the hotel was being renovated it was still a good experience.

Horrendous refurbishments. We had booked The Tuscan when it was part of the Best Western chain and prior to any refurbishments for part of our Honeymoon. We received notification that the hotel had changed names and was also under light refurbishments. We arrived and it was lot more than light refurbishment. It was not the sight you want to see on the first day of your Honeymoon. The staff were adequate but clearly distressed by their working environment. The room was nice however our view was of the Air conditioning unit so not ideal and on the ground floor next to the chaos. You enter via the service entrance and are greeted with great big plastic sheets dust and men in hard hats. We did make a complaint as for 2 days we did not have running water during some points of the day. They did offer us breakfast in the restaurant below. They also said they will provide us with a bottle of champagne which was not delivered so we had to chase. The location is fantastic and is only 2 blocks to the wharf area and other restaurants and shops. Overall I am sure it will be lovely when it is finished. I am not going to be visiting San Fran again so that is not going to help my experience. The hotel should clearly have been closed and quite frankly put a massive damper on what should have been a holiday of our lifetime.

The worst hotel I have ever stayed. Pros. walkable distence to pier 39Belhop was very helpful. Good location to restaurants and grocery shopping. Cons construction and renovation in everywhere. Very dirty and noisy. The elevator was not working so we had to carry on our four big suitcases downstairs from the third floor. Terrible painting smells in the hallways. Overnight parking is so expensive. Overall this hotel is not worthy the money we paid for. And it can not be called not a four star hotel at all. The worst experience in SF.

Horrible experience remodel gone wrong. The door of my room does not even go to the floor there is a 3 inch gap. Hallway light shining through loud voices in the hall and the constant ringing of the elevator bell. Called to complain and receptionist was not apologetic merely saying I could repack and move rooms at 11 pm.

The location and the overall impression. seems New renovated. The settings of air conditioning were at 64 degres and the room needed 15 days to get warmer. Was difficult to change the settings and no description. Parking should be 55 plus tax. This is a no go. We parked in a public parking garage for 25.

Need improvement. I booked this hotel with high expectations as everyone mentions location. Yes you are close to Fisherman ’s Wharf but you can get a nicer hotel even closer. The reason for my low reviews is that this hotel is a area FULL of aggressive homeless people and drug users. They sleep and congregate right in front of the entrance of the hotel meaning when you walk out and they harass you. In addition if you are given the rooms facing that area like mines 428 you will hear them all night arguing and fighting. The common are inside the hotel is nice the fire pits are awesome the welcome drink is appreciated what was not appreciated was the ac broke in our room twice and one of the times the even forgot to come fix it. When we called because we were drenched in sweat an employee brought us a fan that made the worse noise. I called the front desk at 4 am and was told we can switch you to another room this would ’ve been appreciated if it was offered the first night not at 4 am the night we have to catch a flight at 7 am. The next morning I advised the manager what happen and showed her a video of the loud fan and she deducted 1 night even though we had 2 nights of no air conditioner. Honestly I would ’ve rather paid double but had a nice hotel experience. They truly need to clean up the area of homeless. My advice do n’t walk around the area after dark not even to eat because it ’s dangerous as the homeless or drugies harass you asking for money and scream obscenities at you when you do n’t give it or worse of you see them using the bathroom in front of you. Stay somewhere closer to Fisherman ’s Wharf. You will thank me. I have videos I could share.

The location was perfect. The staff were extremely nice. Cute small rooms but if your staying in 1 room with 4 adults it is very hard to find space for things like suitcases and there is not much room for you to walk around in. It is very expensive but worth it.

My advice is to avoid this hotel. I stayed at the Hotel Zoe for 2 nights and I would advise potential customers to avoid this hotel and stay in one of the many other excellent San Francisco hotels. The hotel adds extra charges and includes unnecessary costs in the small print and their staff are dishonest and not up front when asked to explain these charges. I booked the hotel and prepaid in advance through Hotelscom. During my stay I billed nothing to the room. After leaving the hotel I noticed a 60 dollar charge had been billed to my card that I had not been told about on check out. When I emailed the hotel to query this amount they said it was a resort fee for wifi free bottled water in the room use of the gym and newspapers in the lobby. I did not use any of these extras and expect them as standard in other hotels. Indeed there was actually a sign in my room saying bottled water cost 5 and my booking said internet was free. I feel these extra charges were a negative end to my trip. Charging 30 per night for an unused gym and an unread newspaper in the lobby is extortionate. When asked about these charges the staff were evasive and dishonest as several other reviews here testify. An unpleasant experience AVOID.

Almost Got it Right. We stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Zoe at Fisherman ’s Wharf in San Francisco. It is small and quaint hotel in a great location. Close to the Powell Mason cable car and a couple of blocks from the wharf. We had a small suite and I mean small. Enough room for a single or married couple but we had our 12 year old with us and it was a little close quartered for my taste. The barn doors that closed off the bathroom and the living room were stylish but the bathroom door did not close all the way and prevented any level of privacy while in use. The room was pricey and did n’t seem like the experience matched the price. I ate dinner in the restaurant Pescatore. and it was very good reasonably priced and had excellent service. The next morning I ate breakfast there to a completely opposite experience. The waiter served me never refilled my coffee acted surprised when I wanted syrup with my French toast and never returned to bring me the bill. I had ordered eggs and bacon to take back to the room for my son and asked about getting a small carafe of coffee for my wife. I was informed that was a room service feature and I would have to order it through them. They did bring out 2 over easy eggs and bacon in a cardboard to go box. When I asked if I could grab a small plate to take to the room for the eggs I was told by the manager that too was a room service feature and I would have to order from the room. I overheard the waiter argue with the table next to me that Brunch was from 7am10am and they could n’t order off of the breakfast menu. It was 730am at the time. Overall I would suggest someone not stay here I would just warn them to lower their expectations if they are basing the experience on the price they have to pay. Disappointed from Dallas.

The rooms are re designed and the shower is so great. I ve stayed in many hotels and have never experienced a shower like this you have the option to decline room cleaning for a 5 credit at the end of your stay which is good for the environment but did not use it because who does nt want a clean tidy room on their vacations. LolOveral great location and restaurant was delicious their bread and pasta were so good also one of the best place to eat especially if you ’ve had a long day and does nt want to get lost in the streets if san fransisco. Would definitely go back.

If you want to be in Fisherman ’s Wharf. Spent 2 nights at the Hotel Zoe in a Wanderlust Suite 2 adults and 2 kids. Check in was very underwhelming felt like I was doing them a favour by being there I ’ve had better experiences at backpacker hotels in years of old. The hotel room was clean and spacious in the master bedroom the lounge area and fold out couch area however was very tight. We were located on the fourth floor and there was still a lot of noise from outside the hotel appreciate that ’s not the hotels fault but it ’s important if you ’re a light sleeper. The fold out bed itself was horrible in fact we removed the mattress from the base and placed it on the floor so we could get some sleep. the squeaking when it was on the base was very loud. Breakfast at Pescatore was ok although there are plenty of other options in the area. If you want to be located near Fisherman ’s Wharf Zoe is an ok alternative although it ’s not cheap if you want customer service give it a miss. Just good not great.

Choose Sheraton Instead. I was unimpressed with the service at this hotel. From my room I called the front desk twice and got no answer. This is the first hotel I have seen with no coffee maker in the room. The card that explains the 30 day resort fee lists the fruit infused water in the lobby on it. Really. For the same price I had a much better experience across the street at the Sheraton. Hotel Zoe get over yourselves.

This was the worst experience of my life. I booked this room and was totally disappointed. The is the smallest room that I have ever reserved. We had 2 suitcases and to place them on the floor my wife and I were tripping over them because the room was ridiculously small. The water pressure in the bathroom was so weak that it literally felt like a kitten was licking you clean. Beware of the fully stocked mini bar because you will pay a nightly deposit for that. There are no vending machines or store to get water so you will have to go to their restaurant where there is nothing good to eat not even a cheeseburger for the kids. The over head light in the room is very difficult to operate as you have to I guess tap it 3 times to turn it on and off. Please save your money and book somewhere else. I would suggest the Sheraton or the Holiday Inn Express at least you can get a decent breakfast IHOP and Denys were close.
